intro: Frasera caroliniensis, commonly known as the Carolina panicle, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and showy, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along streambanks.
